author: Special Correspondent
text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday criticised the culture of agitations and delays in implementation of projects and spoke about reigniting the manufacturing sector.

Speaking at a public meeting in Paradip after inaugurating the 15-million tonne capacity greenfield oil refinery of Indian Oil Corporation, he blamed the earlier Congress regime for delays in implementation of plans and policies. The NDA government was trying to bring in a culture of implementing projects within time. Unnecessary processes delayed projects and plans, thus affecting the people.

Push for manufacturing

Speaking at the International Fleet Review 2016 at Visakhapatnam in the evening, he talked about reigniting the manufacturing sector with ‘Make in India’. He said the campaign had reignited the manufacturing sector and defence and shipbuilding were the focus areas.
title: Modi blames Congress regime for delaying projects and plans
